title: Man With No Arms Can Shoot Bow

content.en: Can you shoot a bow? It's easy. Put the arrow on the string of the bow. Pull the string. Where do you want the arrow to go? That's your target. Point at your target. Let go of the string. Watch the arrow fly!
content.tw: 你會射箭嗎? 很簡單，把箭放在弓弦上，然後拉弓。你希望弓箭往哪裡射呢? 瞄準你的目標，然後放箭。

content.en: Shooting a bow for sport is fun! But do we need arms to do it?
content.tw: 射箭運動很好玩! 但我們需要手臂才能射箭嗎?

content.en: Ask Matt Stutzman. He was born with no arms. He shoots a bow.
content.tw: 問問看Matt Stutzman，他天生沒有手臂，但他會射箭。

content.en: How does Matt do this? He holds his bow with his foot. He pulls the string with his chin.
content.tw: 他怎麼做到的呢? 他用腳拿弓，用下巴拉弓。

content.en: Matt can hit any target. He shoots very well. He won a silver medal for the USA at the Paralympics. This big competition is for athletes with disabilities.
content.tw: Matt很會射箭，他代表美國在帕運會拿下銀牌。帕運會是為身障運動員舉辦的比賽。

content.en: Matt wants everyone to know he can do anything. His disability doesn't stop him. Matt wants to win a gold medal at next year's Paralympics.
content.tw: Matt希望每一個人都知道身體的缺陷無法限制他，他可以做任何事。他希望能在明年帕運會上贏得金牌。

content.en: This Sunday is the International Day of Persons with Disabilities. Let's learn about Matt and other people with disabilities. Let's learn what they can do!
content.tw: 這個禮拜天是國際身心障礙者日。我們可以從Matt跟其他的身心障礙者身上學習他們可以做到的事。

content.en: Matt uses what he has... and he hits his target!
content.tw: Matt運用他所擁有的…並且達成了他的目標！

vocabulary.preface: 用腳也可以射箭，真是了不起的本領!

content.text: 1. shoot 射擊 Check this out, Nancy. 你看，南西。 I'm going to shoot the bullseye this time. 我這次要射中紅心。 Sure, just like last time when you hit the teacher's hat. 當然，就跟你上次射中老師的帽子一樣。
2. point 指著 I wasn't pointing at her hat! 我並沒有瞄準她的帽子! Oh no, I can't believe I missed it! 我不敢相信我沒射中!
3. target 箭靶 You still hit the target. 你還是射中箭靶啦。 But not the center. 但是不是中心。
4. let go of 放手 I think I let go of the arrow too late. 我覺得我放箭的時間太晚了。 No worries. You'll get better. 別擔心，你會進步的。 Now let me give it a try.現在讓我來試試。

vocabulary.postscript: 你有看過奧運的射箭比賽嗎? shoot射擊 point指出 target箭靶 let go of放手

title: The Beatles Make One More Song

content.en: Who are the Beatles? They're a band from the UK. Many people think the Beatles are the best band in the world!
content.tw: 你知道披頭四嗎? 那是一個英國樂團。很多人覺得披頭四是世界上最棒的樂團。

content.en: The Beatles had four people: John, Paul, George, and Ringo. But they stopped being a band in nineteen seventy. Sadly, John died ten years later…
content.tw: 披頭四有四位成員，約翰、保羅、喬治跟林哥，他們在1970就解散了。十年後約翰不幸地去世。

content.en: But now the Beatles have a new song. What? How can they have a new song? Well, John wrote a song many years ago. It's called "Now and Then". He recorded it on a cassette tape.
content.tw: 但現在披頭四要發行一首新歌 「這時候那時候」。他們怎麼會有新歌呢? 原來約翰很多年前寫了這首歌，並且錄在卡帶上。

content.en: But the recording was very bad. John's voice was hard to hear.
content.tw: 但是錄音品質很糟糕，聽不清楚約翰的聲音。

content.en: After John died, Paul, George, and Ringo took this old song and made it better. But it needed more work. Then George died…
content.tw: 約翰死後，保羅、喬治跟林哥拿到這首老歌，提升了它的品質，但還需要修改。喬治後來也過世了。

content.en: This year, the Beatles made John's voice easy to hear. How did they do that? They used AI.
content.tw: 今年他們用AI人工智慧，讓約翰的聲音更清楚地呈現。

content.en: All four Beatles worked on this song. Paul and Ringo finished it. "Now and Then" is on the radio a lot now. Many people like the song. Many think "Now and Then" is a sad song. But they also think it's a beautiful song.
content.tw: 披頭四的四位成員都參與了這首歌的製作。保羅和林哥完成了它。「這時候那時候」現在廣泛在電台播放。很多人喜歡這首歌。許多人認為「這時候那時候」是一首悲傷的歌。但他們也認為這是一首美麗的歌。

vocabulary.preface: 所有披頭四的成員先後都參與了這首歌的製作，人工智慧也幫了忙。

content.text: 1. best 最好的 July Sky is coming to town! 七月的天空要來這兒! July Sky? What's that? 七月的天空? 那是什麼? You've never heard of them? 你沒聽過他們嗎? I think they're the best band in Taiwan. 我認為他們是台灣最好的樂團。
2. how 如何 How do you know they're coming? 你怎麼知道他們要來? My friend told me. 我朋友告訴我的。 He works in a record company.他在一家唱片公司工作。
3. hard 困難的 Can he get tickets for you? 他可以幫你弄到票嗎? He said it'll be hard. 他說有困難。 Do you want to go to their show? 你想去看他們表演?
4. song 歌曲 Sure, I'd like to hear their songs. 當然，我想去聽他們的歌。 You like joining in on the fun, don't you? 你滿喜歡湊熱鬧的嘛。

vocabulary.postscript: 來跟我一起讀單字。 best最好的 how如何 hard困難的 song歌曲

title: Man Will Ride Bike Across the South Pole

content.en: Man Will Ride Bike Across the South Pole What is the loneliest place in the world? It's somewhere very few people live. Maybe it’s Antarctica! That’s the cold, snowy place around the South Pole.
content.tw: 這世界上最寂寞的地方在哪裡呢? 應該是南極洲，那裡很冷、而且滿地都是雪。

content.en: Omar Di Felice wants to ride his bike all the way across Antarctica. He tried to do this last year. But he stopped after one week. He felt too lonely. His family needed him too.
content.tw: Omar Di Felice 想騎著單車跨越南極洲。他去年試過一次，但一個星期後就放棄了。他當時覺得太孤單寂寞，他的家人也需要他。

content.en: Now Omar wants to try again. He will start at one side. He will cross the South Pole. Then he will finish at the other side. He will ride two thousand kilometers!
content.tw: Omar 現在想再試一次。他要從南極洲的一端騎車2000公里到另一邊。

content.en: Omar has a special bike. It's called a fatbike. It has wide tires. Omar can ride on snow and ice with this bike. He can carry his tent, clothes, and food on this bike.
content.tw: Omar有一個特別的單車，叫做粗輪自行車。這種腳踏車有很寬的輪胎，可以騎在冰雪地面，也可以搭載帳篷、衣服跟食物。

content.en: Riding a bike across Antarctica will not be easy. It will be very cold and very windy. The bike will be heavy. But Omar wants to do this.
content.tw: 騎單車橫越南極洲可不容易，又冷又颳著風。單車也很笨重，但是Omar還是要這麼做。

content.en: Omar will be the first to ride a bike all the way across Antarctica. He knows he will be lonely. But this time, he’s ready!
content.tw: Omar 將會是第一個騎單車橫越南極洲的人。他知道自己會很孤單，但這次他準備好了！

vocabulary.preface: 在南極洲騎單車雖然困難重重，Omar仍然決定再接再厲。

content.text:
1. snowy 下雪的
It snowed on Datunshan last night! 昨天晚上大屯山下雪了!
Oh my God! We must go up there! 天哪，我們一定得趕去!
Now? It could still be snowy and cold. 現在? 可能還在下雪，並且很冷。

2. ride 騎
No worries. 不擔心。
See the sun? The snow has stopped. 看到太陽了嗎? 雪已經停了。
We can even ride my motorbike up there. 我們甚至可以騎摩托車上去。

3. across 橫越
It’ll be faster than driving a car. 會比開車快。
You can count me out. 別把我算進去了。
I don’t want to ride a motorbike across the mountain.我可不想騎摩托車橫越山區。

4. lonely 寂寞孤單的
Come on, Jane! 好啦，珍!
I would feel too lonely without you. 沒有你我會覺得很寂寞。

title: This Planet Has Clouds Made of Sand

content.en: Scientists study planets, stars, and more in space. Space is cool. It has many surprises!
content.tw: 科學家研究太空中的行星跟恆星，還有其他很多現象。外太空總是帶給我們各種驚喜。

content.en: WASP-107b is a planet. It's much bigger than Earth. It's much hotter. It's about 500 degrees! It's close to its sun, so one year is six days!
content.tw: 行星WASP-107b比地球大很多，也比地球熱。它距離它的太陽很近，所以它一年只有6天。

content.en: WASP-107b is strange. Winds blow 36,000 kilometers per hour. And the planet is very light and fluffy! Some scientists call it a "cotton candy" planet.
content.tw: 這顆行星很奇怪。它又輕又蓬鬆，風速還高達6000公里，科學家把它叫做「棉花糖行星」。

content.en: WASP-107b's clouds are very strange. They're made of... sand?!? Scientists think the rocks in the sand are very small. They're smaller than the rocks in Earth's sand.
content.tw: 它的雲層也很奇怪，是由細沙組成。科學家認為沙子中的顆粒非常小，比地球的沙粒小很多。

content.en: These sand clouds make sand rain! The sand goes down to the planet. It turns into a gas. The gas goes up to the clouds. Water does the same on Earth.
content.tw: 這些沙雲會下沙雨! 落到行星的表面就會變成氣體，這些氣體又會上升變成雲，就像地球的水一樣。

content.en: How do scientists know about these sand clouds? A special space telescope showed them. It's helping scientists find out more about space.
content.tw: 科學家透過韋伯太空望遠鏡觀察到這些沙雲。這種望遠鏡幫助科學家更了解太空。

content.en: Clouds rain sand onto a cotton candy planet. What a surprise!
content.tw: 沙雲下在棉花糖行星上。真是令人驚訝！

vocabulary.preface: 這個太陽系外的行星，非常特別。

content.text:
1. cotton candy 棉花糖
Hey, look, there's a cotton candy stand! 你看，那裏有賣棉花糖的攤子。
Cotton candy! 棉花糖!
I haven't had it for years. 我好多年沒吃了。
I loved it when I was little.我小時候好喜歡。

2. cloud 雲朵
Yeah, it's so fluffy it's like eating clouds.
對啊，它好鬆軟，吃起來像在吃雲朵。We'd like 2 cotton candies.
我們要兩支棉花糖。
Sure, that's 60 NT. 好，共六十塊。

3. made of 做成
What is this made of, do you think? 你覺得這是什麼做的呢?
Sugar, of course. 當然就是糖囉。
Just sugar? 只有糖嗎?

4. water 水
Why? You think there's something else? 為什麼? 你覺得還有別的嗎?
I think there's water. 我覺得還有水。

title: Museum to Give Back Important Headdress

content.en: Indigenous people are the first to live in a place. Taiwan has many Indigenous groups: Amis people, Paiwan people, Atayal people, and others.
content.tw: 原住民指的是最開始定居在一個地方的族群。台灣有很多原住民族，像是阿美族、排灣族、泰雅族等等。

content.en: Indigenous groups live all over the world. They have sacred traditions and beliefs. These are very, very important things the groups do and think.
content.tw: 世界各地都有原住民。他們有神聖的傳統跟信仰，這對他們做事情或是思考的方式非常重要。

content.en: They have sacred things. Some are headdresses. These are beautiful head coverings. They have important meanings.
content.tw: 他們有神聖的東西，例如頭飾，也就是戴在頭上的美麗裝飾，這些都有重要的意義。

content.en: The Siksika Nation is an Indigenous group in Canada. About one hundred thirty years ago, a man from the UK took a sacred headdress from them. Then he took it back to the UK. It was in a museum there for more than one hundred years.
content.tw: 西格西卡人是加拿大原住民。130年前，一名英國男子拿走族人的頭飾，帶回英國，收藏在博物館裡超過100年。

content.en: The Siksika headdress has eagle and hawk feathers. It has buffalo horns and porcupine quills. Long ago, an important woman wore it to important religious events.
content.tw: 這個頭飾有老鷹羽毛、水牛角跟豪豬的刺。很久以前，只有身分重要的女性才能穿戴去宗教場合。

content.en: Now the Siksika Nation wants it back!
content.tw: 現在西格西卡人想把它拿回來。

content.en: The museum is sorry they had the headdress. They know it's very important. They're giving it back to the Siksika Nation next year.
content.tw: 博物館覺得很抱歉擁有這個頭飾，他們明白它的重要性，也會在明年歸還給西格西卡人。

content.en: Museums everywhere have sacred things. Let's hope these sacred things go home to their people!
content.tw: 世界各地的博物館都收藏著神聖的物品。希望這些神聖的物品都能回到他們族人的手中！

vocabulary.preface: 英國的博物館對這個原住民族群很抱歉，準備歸還多年前取得的頭飾。

content.text: 1. tradition 傳統 Do Taiwanese women wear a white gown…台灣女子穿不穿白色禮服... when they get married? 結婚時嗎? Yeah, they do. It's a tradition.穿啊，那是傳統。
2. wear 穿著 People here love the color red, too. 這兒的人也喜歡紅色。 They do.是沒錯。 Brides often wear red dresses at the wedding feast.新娘經常在喜宴上穿紅色洋裝。
3. long ago 很久以前。 Long ago my grandma told me red meant celebration. 很久以前阿嬤告訴我紅色表示慶祝。 That's right. 對。
4. hope 希望 Everybody hopes to get red envelopes on New Year's Day. 每個人都希望新年拿紅包。 I certainly hope so! 我當然這麼希望。

vocabulary.postscript: 請來一起讀單字。 tradition傳統 wear穿著 long ago很久以前 hope希望

title: Pets Put On Kimonos for a Special Day in Japan

content.en: Japan has special days for kids. There's Girls' Day. There's Children's Day. There's Shichi-Go-San. Kids think New Year's Day is their day too!
content.tw: 日本有很多兒童的特殊節日，像是女兒節、兒童節、七五三節，甚至是新年兒童也覺得是他們的節日。

content.en: On some special days, families go to a shrine. They pray for their kids' health and happiness.
content.tw: 在特殊節日，父母會帶孩子去神社，祈求孩子健康幸福。

content.en: But Japan doesn't have many kids. Every year, fewer and fewer kids go to shrines.
content.tw: 但是日本少子化，去神社參拜的兒童越來越少。

content.en: Many people have dogs and cats. More and more people take their pets to a shrine. They pray for their pet's health and happiness. But Japan has no special days for pets.
content.tw: 很多人養寵物貓或是狗，帶寵物去神社的人日漸增多，祈求牠們健康平安。但是日本沒有寵物的特殊節日。

content.en: Now there's a special day at the Dog-Cat Shrine near Tokyo! It's Shichi-Go-San for pets. This shrine makes human mommies and daddies of dogs and cats happy.
content.tw: 鄰近東京的神社現在舉辦寵物的七五三節，讓毛小孩主人很開心。

content.en: Kids wear special clothes called kimonos for Shichi-Go-San. So pets wear kimonos too!
content.tw: 兒童會在七五三節穿上和服，貓狗也會在這天穿上和服。

content.en: Kids have to be three, five, or seven years old for Shichi-Go-San. So pets have to be three, five, or seven years old too.
content.tw: 兒童到了三歲、五歲或七歲就會在七五三節去神社參拜。寵物也是一樣。

content.en: For many people, their pets are their family. Now their pets share in a special kids' day at the Dog-Cat Shrine!
content.tw: 對於許多人來說，他們的寵物就是家人。現在他們的寵物也能在狗狗貓貓神社分享一個特別的兒童節！

vocabulary.preface: 寵物很像家人，也有屬於牠們的節日。

content.text:
1. fewer and fewer 越來越少
There are fewer and fewer people keeping birds as pets.
養鳥當寵物的人越來越少了。
You may be right.也許你是對的。
I guess birds are too noisy. 我猜是鳥太吵鬧了。

2. clothes 衣服
When I was little, my mom loved to have birds at home.
我小時候我媽媽喜歡在家裡養鳥。
On cold days, she even put little clothes on them!
天氣冷時她甚至幫鳥穿上小衣服。

3. children 兒童
And we the children were responsible for feeding the
birds.我們這些小孩負責餵鳥。
Did they sing? 牠們會唱歌嗎?
Oh, yes, their sounds were sweet. 會啊，牠們的歌聲很好聽。
They made my family very happy. 讓我的家人很開心。

來一起讀一遍今天的單字。
fewer and fewer越來越少
clothes衣服
children兒童
